channel.title: Client Show-off
channel.description:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/GAs9vsm.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/ic40IL4.png[/img] [img]http://img191.imageshack.us/img191/5817/345bbbe9357c444cb43dcce.png[/img]
Ignore the Youtube and Website, my gfx designer wasn't on and I made it in like 2 minutes.
Also, if anyone knows how I can increase the quality, please let me know.
Feedback is also nice.

item.title: Client Show-off
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

could had sworn I saw that login box before that or I played your server :o

Read full topic

item.title: Client Show-off
item.dc:creator: @zerratar zerratar
item.description:
@zerratar wrote:

[quote=“AnderRoo, post:1, topic:518916”]Ignore the Youtube and Website, my gfx designer wasn’t on and I made it in like 2 minutes.

Also, if anyone knows how I can increase the quality, please let me know.

Feedback is also nice.[/quote]

Change them into a youtube icon and a http icon of some sort. (a globe could do it) Keep it small and simple, put it in the right bottom corner as you have with your currently overbloated youtube button.

And you’ll have a slick and minimal design to it
Looking nice btw!

Read full topic

item.title: Client Show-off
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

AnderRoo:

Any idea where I’d locate it? It’s a PI.

The source has nothing to do with it, it’s all client sided. So, no need to bring up PI.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Show-off
item.dc:creator: @AnderRoo AnderRoo
item.description:
@AnderRoo wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:11, topic:518916”][quote author=AnderRoo link=topic=637185.msg4296097#msg4296097 date=1368244607]

I’m thinking of relocating either both of them to the right or left side, or moving the website box to the bottom aswell, or should I keep them as they are?

You should bump up the palette limitation and fix that nasty login box.

Is it nasty because of the quality or the way it looks in general?

You have the login box cache packed right?

of course, it’d be stupid not to. Unless that’s what’s making the quality bad?
[/quote]
That is. The image format has a limitation of 255 unique colors in the palette. And when cache packing them if it goes over that number it will compress them using a simple algorithm (If it didn’t the images would not load). http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantization_(image_processing)[/quote]

Any idea where I’d locate it? It’s a PI.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Show-off
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“AnderRoo, post:10, topic:518916”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=637185.msg4296095#msg4296095 date=1368244334]

I’m thinking of relocating either both of them to the right or left side, or moving the website box to the bottom aswell, or should I keep them as they are?

You should bump up the palette limitation and fix that nasty login box.

Is it nasty because of the quality or the way it looks in general?

You have the login box cache packed right?
[/quote]

of course, it’d be stupid not to. Unless that’s what’s making the quality bad?[/quote]
That is. The image format has a limitation of 255 unique colors in the palette. And when cache packing them if it goes over that number it will compress them using a simple algorithm (If it didn’t the images would not load). http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantization_(image_processing)

Read full topic

item.title: Client Show-off
item.dc:creator: @AnderRoo AnderRoo
item.description:
@AnderRoo wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:9, topic:518916”][quote author=AnderRoo link=topic=637185.msg4296094#msg4296094 date=1368244017]

I’m thinking of relocating either both of them to the right or left side, or moving the website box to the bottom aswell, or should I keep them as they are?

You should bump up the palette limitation and fix that nasty login box.

Is it nasty because of the quality or the way it looks in general?
[/quote]
You have the login box cache packed right?[/quote]

of course, it’d be stupid not to. Unless that’s what’s making the quality bad?

This is the quality before I put it into the client. (The the top text field is what it is supposed to look like when it’s hovered over.)

Read full topic
